chapter.title: Upgrading the system

abstract.para: &suse; offers a command-line tool to upgrade a running system to a new version. The tool provides support for a rollback to an older release. This chapter explains how to upgrade your system step by step.

chapter.para: &suse; releases a new version of &slema; at regular intervals. To make it easy for customers to migrate to a new minor version and minimize downtime, &suse; supports migrating online while the system is running.
&slema; uses transactional updates to upgrade from one version to the next. This has the following advantages:

listitem.para: Canceling is possible until you reboot your system.
Simple recovery if there is an error.
Possible rollback via system tools—no backup or restore needed.

sect1.title: Upgrading to a new release

important.title: Upgrading to a new release and the networking service
important.para: When you perform an upgrade from previous releases, the default network framework remains the same. Since &slema; 5.3, the default networking service is &nm;. A new installation of &slema; 5.3 is recommended, but if needed, you can switch from wicked to &nm; as described in . However, automated migration from wicked to &nm; or the conversion of the wicked configuration is not supported. &suse; also cannot guarantee full feature parity when switching to &nm;.

A list of packages to be installed or updated is displayed. Press y to continue with the upgrade procedure.
To complete the upgrade, reboot your system and boot into the target version.

sect1.title: Reverting the migration process
sect1.para: If a new release does not work for you, &slema; supports reverting the system to the state before the migration process was started by using the transactional-update rollback command.
The detailed procedure for a system rollback is described in .
